newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK gold ends down on central bank worries.
newsitem.headline: HK gold ends down on central bank worries.

text.p: Hong Kong gold ended down on Thursday from New York's previous close on worries of central bank sales and overseas sell orders, bullion dealers said.
"People are convinced central banks may mobilise resources," said one bullion dealer.
Bullion ended at US$352.00/50 an ounce on Thursday against New York's US$352.70/20 close on Wednesday.
Worries that a proposal that Switzerland sell gold from its reserves to establish a memorial fund for Holocaust victims has added to softer market sentiment.
Some traders reported selling from London in afternoon trade. Sentiment was further weakening, dealers said. Gold would trade between $350 and $356 per ounce, traders said.
Local gold ended HK$59 lower at HK$3,257 a tael.
The carryover charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society dropped to +3.50 from its previous fix at +5.00
